context.description: Message Flow editor - User Defined Properties page You can modify the initial value of a user-defined property at design time or deployment time by the Message Flow editor. You can, for example, use user-defined properties to hold configuration data. You can then configure a message flow for a particular machine, task, or environment at deployment time, without having to change the code at the node level.

topic.label: Configuring a message flow at deployment time using UDPs

context.description: New Message Flow Project wizard Use this wizard to create a new message flow project. When you have created the project, you can create a message flow and other message flow resources.

New Broker Schema wizard Use this wizard to create a new broker schema. You can create a broker schema in a message flow project to organize the resources (such as message flows, ESQL files, and mapping files) within that project. The name of the broker schema becomes part of a resource's fully-qualified file name. For example, if you create a broker schema called "common", the names of all the message flows and other resources within that schema are prefixed with "common". This means that you can have more than one message flow (or other resource) of the same name within the same project, as long as each of the message flows is in a different broker schema. The broker schema called "(default)" is automatically created when you create the message flow project.
New Message Flow wizard Use this wizard to create a new message flow. You can create a message flow in an application, a library, or an Integration project.
New Subflow wizard Use this wizard to create a new deployable subflow. You can create a subflow in an application, a library, or an Integration project.
